briefing.opening: Good morning/afternoon, everyone. We will now commence the climate briefing for March 2, 2026.

sections.title: ğŸ”´ Climate Crisis Becoming a Reality and Urgent Call for Action
sections.content: The news released today clearly demonstrates that climate change is no longer a future threat, but an immediate reality. In particular, the forecast that record-high temperatures will be recorded in 2024 and 2025 serves as a wake-up call [2]. Already, shorter winters are being observed in the United States [6], and domestically, the water crisis is deepening, with the Unmun Dam in the Nakdong River basin entering a drought 'alert' phase [31]. Furthermore, climate change is threatening underwater archaeological treasures [32], leading to increased insurance premium burdens in Australia [35], and research has reported negative impacts on coffee crops worldwide [36]. These warnings strongly suggest the need for a comprehensive and immediate response to the climate crisis.

sections.title: ğŸ‡°ğŸ‡· Domestic Policy and Legal System Overhaul Trends
sections.content: Domestically, efforts to refine policies and legal frameworks for climate change response are ongoing. While the Presidential Committee for National Climate Crisis Response is playing a crucial role [1, 5], public discourse on the 'Framework Act on Carbon Neutrality', which was ruled 'unconstitutional' two years ago, has officially begun, drawing attention to the future discussion process [7, 8, 13]. Meanwhile, it has been pointed out that real-time AXDX conversion is essential for public institutions to prepare for mandatory ESG disclosure in 2026, emphasizing the urgency of building related systems [24]. Establishing such legal and institutional foundations is essential for enhancing the efficiency of climate crisis response.

sections.title: ğŸŒ± Multifaceted Efforts to Achieve Carbon Neutrality
sections.content: Various domestic efforts to transition to a carbon-neutral society have been reported. The Rural Development Administration and the Ministry of Food and Drug Safety have begun establishing pesticide standards in response to the increase in subtropical crops due to climate change [3], and the Korea Water Resources Corporation (K-water) is integrating climate change response into water resource management by holding a new green algae technology forum [4]. At the local government level, Danyang County is operating a hydrogen charging station, exploring a transition to a carbon-neutral transportation system [9, 11, 22], and Yongin City and Gwangju City are recruiting participants for the 'Vehicle Carbon Neutrality Point System' based on driver mileage, encouraging citizen participation [10, 18, 21, 23]. Furthermore, the Ministry of Science and ICT has formed a public-private task force (TF) for international cooperation on carbon neutrality [12], and the first meeting of the TF for implementing the 2050 Carbon Neutrality Promotion Strategy has been held, strengthening momentum for achieving carbon neutrality goals at a national level [20]. Suseong-gu, Daegu, is developing blueprints for creating a carbon-neutral urban environment and holding related forums, seeking solutions tailored to local characteristics [15, 16, 17], and the Korea Environment Corporation has expressed its commitment to actively participate in the public sector K-RE100 initiative to contribute to carbon neutrality [19]. Gwangmyeong City is distributing eco-friendly effective microorganism (EM) fermented solution for free, supporting carbon reduction practices in daily life [25].

sections.title: ğŸŒ± Expansion of Renewable Energy and Eco-friendly Technologies
sections.content: Globally, the transition to renewable energy and the development of eco-friendly technologies are accelerating. China has built the world's largest renewable energy system, raising the proportion of green electricity to approximately 40% [26]. Domestically, National Assembly member Lee Won-taek emphasized preparing to attract future industries through the expansion of renewable energy and green hydrogen infrastructure [27], and BayWa r.e. is contributing to renewable energy expansion by signing an agreement with Hankuk Paper for an additional 40MW onshore wind power development project [28, 29]. Furthermore, with the impending opening of 'InterBattery 2026', expectations are rising for the advancement of K-battery technology and the advent of the 'era of battery of things' [30], indicating that key technologies for energy transition are expected to advance further.

briefing.closing: Today's briefing has highlighted the urgent reality of the climate crisis and the diverse policy and technological efforts, both domestic and international, to overcome it. This is a time when continuous attention and action become even more crucial. This concludes today's climate briefing.

articles.description: [Press Release] 1st Meeting of Carbon Neutrality TF Held for Seamless Implementation of 2050 Carbon Neutrality Promotion Strategy National Climate Crisis Response Committee

summary.phenomenon: The first meeting of the Carbon Neutrality Task Force (TF), aimed at the seamless implementation of the 2050 Carbon Neutrality Promotion Strategy, has been held.

articles.title: 'InterBattery 2026' Nears Opening, K-Battery Heats Up... "Accelerating the Era of Battery of Things"
articles.original_title: â€˜ì¸í„°ë°°í„°ë¦¬ 2026â€™ ê°œë§‰ ì½”ì•, ë‹¬ê¶ˆì§€ëŠ” Kë°°í„°ë¦¬Â·Â·Â·â€œì‚¬ë¬¼ë°°í„°ë¦¬ ì‹œëŒ€ ì•ë‹¹ê¸´ë‹¤â€
articles.description: LG Energy Solution announced on the 2nd that it will participate in 'InterBattery 2026'. Provided by LG Energy Solution. While electricity has expanded human life and activity, bringing significant ripple effects across society, the advent of batteries, which store energy for use when needed, innovatively connects the world. Beyond electric vehicles (EVs) and energy storage systems (ESS), batteries are used in robots, drones, and even aerospace satellites...

summary.phenomenon: LG Energy Solution announced on the 2nd that it will participate in 'InterBattery 2026'.
summary.cause: Batteries play a pivotal role in innovatively connecting the world across various sectors, including electric vehicles, energy storage systems, robots, drones, and aerospace satellites, by storing energy for use when needed.
summary.outlook: The advancement of batteries is expected to accelerate the 'Era of Battery of Things' across diverse fields such as electric vehicles, energy storage systems, robots, drones, and aerospace satellites.

articles.title: Unmun Dam in Nakdong River Basin Enters 'Caution' Stage for Drought
articles.original_title: ë‚™ë™ê°•ê¶Œì—­ ìš´ë¬¸ëŒ ê°€ë­„ â€˜ì£¼ì˜â€™ë‹¨ê³„ ì§„ì…
articles.description: The Ministry of Climate, Energy and Environment announced that as of 2 AM on the 2nd, Unmun Dam, a water supply dam in the Nakdong River system in Cheongdo-gun, Gyeongsangbuk-do, has entered the 'Caution' stage for drought, and measures to conserve dam water will be implemented. Rainfall in the Unmun Dam basin this year was 23.2 mm, which is only 35.5% of the average year's rainfall (65.3 mm). Rainfall from September 21 last year until today was 169.6...

summary.phenomenon: Unmun Dam, located in the Nakdong River system in Cheongdo-gun, Gyeongsangbuk-do, entered the 'Caution' stage for drought as of 2 AM on the 2nd. This year's rainfall in the Unmun Dam basin measured 23.2 mm, representing only 35.5% of the average annual rainfall of 65.3 mm.
summary.cause: The cause is significantly lower rainfall compared to previous years, with only 169.6 mm recorded from September 21 last year until today.
summary.outlook: The Ministry of Climate, Energy and Environment plans to implement measures for dam water conservation.
